hero.heading: Hello
hero.copy: Building a better digital government for all
hero.copy2: We believe in ethical, inclusive design that is transparent, open source, and Veteran-centric.

about-us.heading: About
about-us.copy: United Digital Partners offers a proven approach to technology, design, and research that delivers meaningful digital services to our federal government clients. Our extensive experience working with VA and their end users allows us to readily empathize and craft digital solutions that address the unique challenges our government partners face as they transition, build, and commission products and services for the public.
about-us.copy2: We retain historically disadvantaged business certifications through our ownership, including 8(a) and SDVOSB designations that make us eligible for set-asides. Our leadership is comprised of immigrants and users of VA system.

competencies.heading: Core Competencies
competencies.copy:
**Tech and Data** Software Development, Open Source, APIs, Lean Agile Engineering, Cloud Computing and Cloud Services, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Data Science, Data Analytics, Legacy Modernization, Digital Transformation, DevSecOps, Cyber Security, Data Architecture, Data Warehousing, Master Data Management, Business Intelligence (BI), Data Visualization, Internet of Things (IoT)

**Procurement** Acquisitions, Contracting, Vendor Management

**People and Organization** Bureaucracy Hacking, Product Management, Agile Project Management, Innovation Labs, Training

**Design and Content** Human-Centered Design, User Research, Content Strategy, User Experience (UX)Design, Brand and Identity, Illustration, Copywriting, Accessibility

**Policies and Standards** Federal Acquisition Regulation, Paperwork Reduction Act, FISMA, Privacy Act / HIPAA / FERPA, Section 508, Schedule A(r) Hiring Authority, Authority to Operate (ATO)

our-work.heading: Our Work
our-work.copy2: There's a lot more we've done, but we want to talk about what we can do next—with you.

our-approach.heading: Our Approach
our-approach.copy:
Every day millions of people—from Veterans to immigrants—depend on government services to fulfill their needs. But too often these services are delivered using outmoded policies, practices, and technologies. We're public servants at heart who are driven to make these services work better in a digital world, and that involves implementing a Human-Centered Design (HCD) approach to designing services and products.

Our HCD approach empowers teams to understand, ideate, and design products, services, systems, and experiences that address real users’ core needs. As the foundation of any engagement, HCD acts as a focal lens on the people and processes behind the technology challenges we solve. User experience and direct user research help us understand needs, pain points, and motivations users have as they engage with the services we provide.

We’ve also instituted lean-Agile practices and engineering throughout our entire company to ensure that everything we offer is designed to enable government success in the digital age through modern practices. Assumptions are risky. We answer critical strategy, design, and tech questions with our rapid, customer-driven, iterative approach to prototyping. Teaming with other cross-functional teams is often a critical and mutually beneficial approach for both the government and for those who partner with the government to bring viable, modern services and solutions to the public.

Each aspect of our approach helps ensure we were delivering the best possible product for a large user base.

differentiators.heading: Differentiators
differentiators.copy:
* Board Director & President, AIGA
* Former White House Creative Director 
* Founder, DotGov Design initiative and conference (AIGA DC)
* Co-founder & member, Digital Services Coalition (DSC)
* Veterans in Procurement (VIP) Graduate
* National Veteran Small Business Coalition member
* Former Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)
differentiators.copy2:
* Former United States Digital Service (USDS) Directors, served at:
* Department of Defense (DoD)
* Department of Homeland Security (DHS)
* United States Department of Agriculture (USDA)
* United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS)

contact-us.copy:
